reviews.text: I recently visited Salzburg and found this nice family-run hotel within walking distance of all the main sights and the train station.
reviews.title: A nice well-sited hotel

reviews.text: Being family-run the Trumer Stube had the sort of personal attention you don't get in chain hotels The family: father, mother, daughter were fabulous whether preparing breakfast in the morning or giving guidance to guests including ones who lacked sufficient German language skills. It is also very affordable especially considering Salzburg is a major tourist city.
reviews.title: Shady credit card policy

reviews.text: The good: The location was in central Salzburg, within close walking distance of all major Salzburg sights. The hotel personnel were friendly, although they constantly gave us the hard up-sell on all kinds of cheesy touristy activities. Be prepared to be subjected to a cheery sales routine.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The very bad: We were lied to about their credit card policy, and forced to pay in cash. When I tried to pay for the room with a credit card (a US-issued Visa), the girl at the desk refused to accept it. I was told that they would only take cash. When I explained that I had no cash and had expected to pay by credit card, I was very cheerfully pointed to the nearest ATM. If I had known that they wouldn't accept credit cards, I would have stayed elsewhere. It's a perfectly fine hotel, but a little truth-in-advertising would've helped. (Surprisingly, I don't see too many other reviews that complain about this ... perhaps others were warned about the card policy ahead of time, or the owners just chose to screw with us for some reason. Either way, it doesn't help matters.)
reviews.title: Charming small hotel with a very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I hadn't been treated so poorly by the owners, I might've recommended the place. The location IS convenient. If you can get a low enough rate, try it out, but be sure to bring a stack of euros just in case they try to pull the same scam.
reviews.title: A home from home in the heart of Salzburg.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a little dated and could use some updating in decor and facilities - our shower had tiles misissing where it attached to the floor but the room was clean and the location was O.K. Just a tip if you are walking there from the station - the map they supply on the internet looks like you take the first left (the first underpass on your left) but you have to take the second. ( If I were to do it again I would take a taxi to the hotel! ) The hotel is near lots of good local restaurants (try the little Greek one a couple of streets away as it was excellent) and it doesn't take very long to get to the touristy part of Salzburg. You can also purchase the "Salzburg" card at the front desk of the hotel which is worth the price as you can go to many popular sites with one card ( it did not cost any extra to buy it at the hotel). Overall, it was not a bad little hotel.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: We really enjoyed this hotel, as much as we enjoyed the city of Salzburg. Situated across the river from the old/historic part of town, it is well within walking distance to everything. We used Salzburg as a home base to day trip all across Austria. The hotel and the staff were very accommodating. The owners provided helpful advice on recommending dining options, driving in Austria (and across the border to Germany). Service every morning for breakfast was very warm and welcoming, we felt very much "at home" and part of a family during our stay. The rooms were small (like most rooms in europe) but clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were a little small and in need of updating, but nothing to make us reconsider our stay. THe showers were very small (not much room to move - dont drop the soap, it will be hard to bend over and pick it up).
reviews.title: Very Quaint

likes.disliked: — small older bathrooms - but a not deal breaker

reviews.text: There was a computer in the lobby (no wireless at the time) for use to email. Connection was slow.
reviews.title: This is a Great hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights, at the end of a longer holiday in Austria. The room was immaculately clean - and the staff went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel - Great Hosts

reviews.text: Silvia was absolutely charming and helpful - Giovanni busied himself at breakfast without upsetting anyone.
reviews.title: Hotel Staff a Nightmare!

reviews.text: This hotel was good value for money and in a great location. There was a really nice little square nearby with good atmosphere and restaurants. Also, the old town was only 5/10 minutes pleasant walk away. Both owners were friendly and Sylvia was very helpful with tourist information. Rooms were plain but clean & comfy so no complaints there.
reviews.title: Hotel Trumer Stube - would definitely go back

likes.disliked: — Nothing really. Room could have been bigger for a triple.

reviews.title: Great Place, great hosts
reviews.text: I cannot see how people could complain about this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable, great character, and the owners were excellent hosts. We booked for two nights and stayed for 4. The location and price are excellent, and the owners helped us make the most of our time there. We cannot wait to go back. There is so much to do and appreciate in Salzburg.
I have no hesitation in recommending this Pension to all visitors and cannot see why people stay in hotels when there are these options available.
reviews.title: Nasty Innkeepers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked owner, Sylvia if the Iron I was borrowing required water and how to regulate temp. She yelled in my face "I told you it is ready"
reviews.title: Good location in Salzburg

reviews.text: The following all occurred at one breakfast:
reviews.title: Chintzy and triendly

likes.liked: — Its central location and friendly owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our stay as part of a package taking in Salzburg and a stay in the Austrian lake district. The hotel is ideally situated to visit all the main attractions in Salzburg on foot. The hotel is run Silvia on reception and Giovanni in the breakfast room. Silvia could be a lillte brusque in her manner but we found her helpful and with a good command of English. Giovanni, in spite of other peoples comments was friendly and helpful and always offered extra coffee at breakfast. Our main concerns were with the room and its location opposite a club. The room, on the second floor at the front was dark, had limited space and the mattress was rock hard (seems to be a feature of many hotel rooms!) The road opposite was narrow and high, so sounds echo considerably. Directly opposite was a club. We had a lot of noise from people out on the street and on one night there was loud music until very late. We had to keep the window closed in spite of temperatures in the 30s and no airconditioning.
reviews.title: Good location but noisy

likes.disliked: — Noise from club acrros the road

reviews.title: An Extremely Bad Hotel - Stay Away From It
reviews.text: While the hotel's location was close to the old city and was clean, the service was HORRIFIC! The owners Silvia and Giovanni treated my family rudely and with great disrespect. For example, during breakfast we asked Giovanni for some coffee. In response he yelled, I mean yelled at us, walking away telling us not to worry about having coffee. He treated all guests this way.

reviews.title: Friendly, helpful, B&B
reviews.text: I know that we look for inexpensive, clean hotels located close to the sites that we are visiting. However, the travel experience is much much more than that. The people we meet, how we are treated and what we learn about the country and culture we are visiting adds to our experiences. There is no excuse for how we were treated at this hotel. We cannot recommend this to any of our friends and we will never return this hotel.

Both Silvia and Giovanni are bad examples of the warm that the German people and culture offer to visitors. They should be ashamed of how they treat people and how the represented their country and culture! If they don’t change there attitudes and treatment of guests….eventually their business will suffer. Silvia didn’t even bother to thank us for our patronage and 103 euros. For those of you looking for a hotel in Salzburg, DO NOT STAY HERE NO MATTER WHAT POSITIVE THINGS YOU MAY READ ABOUT THIS HOTEL!!
reviews.title: Perfectly satisfactory Salzburg pension
Phew!
reviews.text: Reception was most welcoming and the room was very clean, quiet, reasonable, and comfortable. Location right near the Salz River and Mirabell Gardens was excellent, very convenient to all locations by foot. Host Silvia offered kind greetings and helpful services for advice and reservations. Mozart Dinner Concert was marvelous. Salzburg has lots to do and see! We enjoyed the charming Italian greetings from Giovanni every morning! Silva shared her yummy, healthy recipe for the dish of oatmeal, nuts, fruit, and yogurt, which was served on the breakfast buffet each day. Very friendly B & B, highly recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This pension is an easy 5 minute walk across the river to the Old Town section of Salzburg. The young woman at the front desk was very sweet and spoke excellent English. She was very helpful about suggesting things to do. Both the woman and her father (?) were very accommodating and friendly. When we needed a cab to pick us up at 3:45am, the man got on the phone right away and took care of scheduling it for us. They both seemed to eager to make sure we had a pleasant stay. I also appreciated that the father took the time to chat with me in German, even though my German is a little rusty.
reviews.title: Pleasant pension with wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice-sized and clean. There was a desk, a comfortable couch and a bed. The bathroom was large and had a good shower. We also enjoyed the free wifi.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two things to note: 1) Even though we reserved the hotel with a credit card on Expedia, we were asked when we checked in if we wouldn't mind settling our bill in cash. 2) There wasn't always someone at the front desk. This is to be expected with a family-run place, but the posted sign was misleading (i.e., it read something like "this desk is staffed until 9:00pm" but there was no one there at 7:30pm). Maybe they just stepped out, but it happened twice.
reviews.title: quiet and charming

reviews.text: Overall, this was a lovely pension and the staff were terrific.
reviews.title: Charming little family-run place

reviews.text: Ms. Marianne and her family made our stay at this hotel very pleasant. Their attention to their guests' was outstanding with their welcoming smiles and friendly personalities. The central location was fantastic, as was the home cooked breakfasts. The rooms were true to the character of the region but none the less comfortable and clean, and affordable. We highly recommend this hotel and extend our thanks and appreciation to the family for making our brief stay in Salzburg very rewarding.
reviews.title: Austrian cosiness for at reasonable price

reviews.text: We were disappointed with our stay at Hotel Trumer Stube, but it was somewhat comic relief as well.
reviews.title: Great location, very outdated accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me explain. Upon checking in, I asked if the 3 rooms we had booked would be on the same floor, and Ms. Marianne informed us that they were not because she wanted to ensure we had "the best rooms" for us. Well, needless to say I was very surprised to see pink satin ruffles embedded into the ceiling directly on top of the bed (circa 1970's), matching pink towels in the bathroom, and a view of the alley way from the window! There was also construction at 7 am in the morning that was terribly loud as well.
reviews.title: Special help from the staff ensured a fantastic visit

reviews.text: The only positive part of our experience was that it was in a good location, but outside of that I would not stay here again. Serves me right for not booking another hotel in advance!!!
reviews.title: The Hotel Trumer Stube was simply wonderful, especially the caring family running the hotel.

reviews.text: Also,
reviews.title: Nice hotel with home's atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Advice from the desk staff (manager) helped immensely. Room was very comfortable & clean, excellent value for the money. Location was truly walking distance to everything, except perhaps the train station (cab was easy). We felt we were staying with friends from the moment we walked in.
reviews.title: Friendly and Good Salzburg Location
In Salzburg with the Breakfast Nazi
reviews.text: I have designed and lead custom European tours for adult travelers for fourteen of the past fifteen summers. Over the years I have stayed in scores of hotels in Europe, more particularly, four different hotels in Salzburg. Three of the four Salzburg hotels that I have used have been excellent in service and accomodations. I continue to frequent these three as often as they are available for booking for my tour groups. Having just discovered your review service, I felt compelled to write my impressions about the fourth and unsatisfactory of these hotels. With each of my usual three Salzburg favorite hotels unavailable, our group stay at the Hotel Trumer Stube during the summer of 2003. Although the hotel itself is well located to access the old part of the city of Salzburg, and the accomodations adequate, the treatment of its guests leaves much to be desired. On this first (and last) group visit, we found Giovanni, the male co-manager of the hotel, to be surly, rude, and inconsiderate in his treatment of numerous members of our group. Our group remained in good spirits, in spite of his relentless herding of guests from table to table, often midway through their breakfast meal, and his excessively gruff disposition. The group quickly nicknamed him, the "Breakfast Nazi" amongst themselves. When I politely expressed my concern over this unfortunate mistreatment of the group to the attention of Silvia, the hotel co-manager, she only shrugged her shoulders. The abuse continued for the remaining two days of our stay. I will not be using this hotel again in the future, nor can I in good conscience recommend it to others.

reviews.title: Thumbs down, down, down...
reviews.text: Bare minimum courtesy from Silvia and unsmiling grouchiness from Giovanni (owners of the hotel) were certainly not our idea of "friendly" staff.

reviews.title: Friendly, cosy and quiet
reviews.text: Extremely cramped room with no fridge - only a TV that has no remote control and poor breakfast selection.

reviews.title: Family Run Excellence
reviews.text: To top it off, we received a letter from Silvia claiming that we had not returned them the room keys and would be charging us 30 euros for that. That is absolutely ridiculous because she herself called a cab to take us to the train station while we waited at the hotel lobby AFTER we had checked out, returned the keys and settled the bill!

I and my family with two friends stayed in Salzburg two days from 2 to 4 of April 2010. As I was searching for an hotel not far from the center I found the Trumer Stube Hotel by searching on web. Booking it was easy even we had to change the dates previously booked. Once arrived at the hotel, you can park the car along the Bergstrasse (if you can find place to park and it is not so easy), or park it (better) at Mirabell Parking, not far from the hotel, paying a fee of 13 euros per day by presenting the ticket with the stamp of the hotel at the cash desk. Remember not to pay on Sundays or holidays, because the cash desk is closed and you have to use the automatic cash where you have to pay the entire fee of 15 euros per day.
reviews.title: Comfortable Salzburg

reviews.text: The hotel is in a very strategic position as it is situated few steps before the Staatsbruecke, the main bridge of the city; you go downtown old Salzburg really in five minutes walking from the hotel. I have booked one double room and one triple room: The double room was nice and well confortable, the triple room was just confortable; both are well-equipped with separate bathroom and TV. The breakfast is served from 7,30 a.m. to 9,30 a.m. and it is plentiful of foods, coffee, tea, juices, without limitations.
reviews.title: Fine Location and Good Choice in Beautiful Salzburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners themselves are employed in breakfast and reception services and this gives a familiar atmosphere to the clients: particularly Miss Marianne Hirschbichler, one of the family owner, at the reception, gives you every information you ask for your best staying in Salzburg and tries to solve little problems with a sincere kindness. The prices of the rooms booked was quite cheap, considering the fact that the hotel is close to the old Salzburg and to the top places to visit there. On my opinion, the triple rooms could be situated and equipped in a better way of the actual ones.
reviews.title: Good value, not great location

reviews.text: If you are planning to visit Salzburg this is an hotel to consider.
reviews.title: Great Hotel; Giovanni can be delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night in July 2009. Our tested and true Garmin Nuvi took us right to the door of this otherwise tricky to find hotel. We liked the Trumer Stube as a very good value in a fine location. Sylvia was exceptional and helpful. The room overlooked the street and was clean and nicely decorated with a good shower. The breakfast was good but did not stand out.
reviews.title: Good deal with nice people
